intro: Tanacetum flaveolum, commonly known as the yellow tansy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided, aromatic leaves and yellow ray florets. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Tanacetum flaveolum is known for its strong, camphor-like scent and has been historically used in herbal medicine.
